name: eupatorium hyssopifolium
description: NEW!  At the end of the growing season, Eupatorium hyssopifolium blooms in bursts of white flowers throughout a meadow.  It prefers drier growing conditions, but can handle wetter ones so long as the site is well-drained.  Like other Eupatoriums, Hyssop-leaved thoroughwort is a host plant for the Clymene moth. Also called Hyssopleaf Boneset.
